data.title: Downtown Glendale
data.text: Not a great motel to be honest. The design makes it feel like a bit of a prison system. Not much in-room kit for coffee or anything. Bed was comfy,  shower was clean and it is central to the downtown precinct so it ticks a couple of boxes.

data.title: Getaway
data.text: This annual visit I asked the sheets & pillowcases to be replaced due to (wrinkled/hair) they got the maid immediately to take care of it.  Everything else was great as usual. I will be returning next year

data.title: Quaint motel with big problems
data.text:
Room was clean, staff was kind, BUT...
No continental breakfast, No in room coffee, not even shampoo in the bathroom.  Had to pay for it out of a vending machine.
Pool area was occupied by unfavorable people who were smoking pot and drinking all day.

Most importantly, the motel is adjacent to a major train/vehicle intersection and the trains blow their horns very frequently all hours of the day and night.  Do not expect anything resembling a good night's sleep.
Would not recommend this motel to anyone.

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team Member at Motel 6 Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dallas, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We sincerely apologize for your unpleasant stay due to the noise inconveniences you experienced. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest, and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the noise of the train you describe. We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced in with our location. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quick Get Away
data.text:
We stayed one night.
Place was nice. 
The price reasonable.
Would stay again. 
Their was a restaurant close by
and other fast food places like 
In & Out. Close to the highway and a gas station close by too. 
Easy check in and out 
The reception was good 
Could be a little more polite.

data.title: Decent room for decent price
data.text: Room was decent and clean, good price for budget travelers, suited our needs just fine, hotel is close to train, so there is a little train noise but not a real big deal, hotel is close to Cardinals Stadium and Coyotes Arena which a plus

data.title: paid but didn't stay
data.text: The cleaning smell was so strong that I couldn't stay in room, kept wondering what happened that it needed that strong a cleaner. Paid for night but did not stay. The place is a real dump. Not in a good part of town

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team Member at Motel 6 Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
 Thank you for sharing your feedback. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable visit and apologize for any failure in following through on that commitment during your recent stay. We strive to provide a clean, comfortable stay and are disappointed your visit was unsatisfactory due to the odor concern you describe. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Only if you like Train Noise
data.text: Found property to be "Spartan" at best. Had pool (nice), room had no closet, A/C was loud, and the trains make a lot of noise and I was on the far side of the property. Neighborhood seemed sketchy and parking was problematic and unsecured. I cannot recommend staying here, unless you have no other options!

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team Member at Motel 6 Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
James,
           Thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize for your unpleasant stay as a result of the inconveniences you experienced with the size of the room and the comfort of your bed during your recent stay. Please know the window condition you describe is an exception to our guest commitment and as such, we apologize for the noise inconvenience you describe.  Motel 6 standards for quality rest on our promise to offer the lowest price of any national chain by delivering the essential elements of a comfortable room for a satisfying stay, for this reason we apologize for the disappointment you describe with the expectations of amenities. The service issues you describe are atypical to Motel 6 standards for quality, and we are sorry you experienced less than satisfying service during your visit. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Helpful, friendly staff. Worst room ever!
data.text: The manager Hirem and staff were friendly and helpful. Got the feeling they make the best of what they have. What they have is awful. The physical condition of the room was the worst I have ever seen! The a'c was by the loudest I've heard. Don't even try to watch TV with it on, sounds like an 18-wheeler has pulled into the room. The bedspread was so gross and disgusting. Goodwill would throw it in the dumpster. Stains all over it. The vinyl/wallpaper was peeling off the walls and filthy and disgusting. No towel rack in the room. 1 end-piece, no rod and a hole in the wall where the other end-piece was supposed to be. All the walls were dirty and stained. The sink and tub were tarnished a deep brown color. Baseboards were not existent, looked like they ha been eaten away by mold or something. Large gaps throughout. Didn't want to touch anything I din't need to including the rusted door locks, knobs etc. Would not stay here again. Gross Wifi was slow and cumbersome

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team Member at Motel 6 Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in delivering on the commitment during your recent stay. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the comfort issues you describe. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dirty Franchise
data.text:
Alright, let me start off by saying I worked for a franchise Motel 6; notably in Northern Arizona.  As workers we get a 30% discount, friends and family rate for one or two rooms.  At first management or the owner was not going to honor the 30%.   Cigarette burns on the covers, the rooms we have are remodels!  We were too tired to notice any of the bedding.

It is currently 15 minutes until 6 PM after our first night.  Our rooms weren't even serviced since we left at 8 AM, that's a whole 10 hours!  Don't get me wrong when you have a full house there is a little delay.  When I confronted Mayra(front desk clerk) she hit me with excuse, after excuse, after excuse.  If you do get a room, at this location, make sure your room is on the low count...they clean the rooms in numerical order.  Corporate could not help out with the situation and I'm stuck with this dilemma for the next 2 evenings.  The picture is what my fiancé's brother was greeted to after we visited dirty rooms.  If you really need a place to stay I would advise spending an extra $40 elsewhere.  This is me telling you a potential guest that my discount could not make up for this kind of treatment.  This is my first review as well, I seriously didn't want to write this but damn.  This particular establishment needs to seriously become corporate.

data.title: Worth a 2nd chance
data.text: Was here last Oct 2014 and wasn't sure would return.  I'm glad I did, it has new owners as of 6 months ago and they are doing a great job improving the place.  Was greeted impeccably nice and given a nice room close to office area.  Room clean, great comfortable king bed.  On major bus line and walking distance to downtown area restaurants.  2nd chance.

data.title: Mixed feelings
data.text: Since we were headed home to Dallas area from Cali, we decided to stop by Surprise and see the TX Rangers play at training camp game.  When I began looking for a hotel room I was surprised!  The hotels were running $150-$250 and up, even typically lower cost chains.  The Motel 6 was less than $100, so I reserved it.  The area felt a little sketchy, and oddly enough, vehicles were parked behind buildings,with no view from any room.  Getting to the room meant entering a code in a gate.  Once inside, there was a courtyard with a pool, and oncein the room, it was fine, clean and safe.  If we saw another game we would probaby pay a little more and stay even closer to Surprise, Sun City I think.  If not available Id probably return to this one.

data.title: 4 star service
data.text: Clean and very well managed. Just had my husband and son stay here for the Super Bowl. Denise, the Assistant Manager,and her staff (especially Mayra) were amazingly helpful. Service was like a 4 star hotel, doesn't get better.

data.title: Upscale Motel 6
data.text: Updated Motel 6 with in walking distance to Glendale Historic District.  Wood floors,  furnished Ikea style,  nice pool with patio furniture n barbeque. About 7miles to University of Phoenix Stadium n Westgate Center.  And a bargain compared to other hotels in the area. Definitely will go back.

data.title: Terrible service
data.text:
I have stayed at this Motel 6 in the past for spring training, and not had a problem. This time, oh boy...

1. The telephone didn't work - the line had been cut but the phone itself, with a cut line coming out of the wall, was still in the room. We took it to the front desk asking for a new phone, and never got one.

2. Bed Bugs!!! I was bit about 50 times by bed bugs over the last two nights; when I said something to the front desk late on the last night (I wanted to see if the manager was going to be in the next day), I was offered a new room.

I sent the manager an email, then came to the front desk when i checked out. I told them that I didn't want to make a big deal out of it, but that the stay was pretty bad, and thought some kind of partial refund was fair. The manager, without saying a word, left the room, and then went to my room. I was still at the frond desk. He calls the front desk, asking me to come to the room.

To his credit, he's pulled the bed apart, but he's looking for bed bugs during the day with his Iphone light! When I showed him the blood marks on the bed, all he could say was "bed bugs are easy to find". I told him that, unfortunately, I had a duty to write a bad review of his place; he really didn't care.

Since that Motel 6 is a franchisee place, corporate won't help. I'd suggest finding another place.

owner_response.author: David W, Guest Relations Manager at Motel 6 Glendale, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Jeremy D, 

Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am sorry to hear about your problems during your recent stay. I have spoken with the hotel management about the phone issue and they are working on a resolution. The beg bug issues is being addressed with our corporate offices. I have requested an investigation to not only the bugs but the managers response as well. In the meantime would you like to add anything please feel free to contact me. 

Thank you, 
David
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Traveler with Dog
data.text:
Above average Motel 6, but am not sure it is worth the extra money as the area is not as nice as it may seem. Three squad cars arrived at the motel late afternoon and took someone away and in the morning I was hit up for change, cigarettes, or something by a couple I found out was staying at the motel. Went for a drive and got back about 9:30 and had to  bully my way past a big black truck parked squarely in the center of the driveway, edge around it after it backed up in order for me to park my car, and then do a stare down with a kid going into the pool area.
From what I can see, the gates giving access to the room areas were not locked at night though they have card access slots so anybody can walk into what is suppose to be a secure gated area. It is not a slum area, but is on the border.
The ac blew cold, but also blew all its air right on my head no matter where I slept in the king bed.
The rooms were nice, I checked in early, and the furnishings were not all burned in places. Pillow top mattress and very nice pool area.

A plus, is that this motel is located a few blocks from the Glendale historic downtown and antique area, but I would not advise single females to just wander that spot at night. If you do go, head for the Murphy Haus for German beer and cheap to expensive eats with great staff members.

Nice park for dog walking one to two blocks into the downtown.

data.title: Lacking in the Fundamentals
data.text:
Oh Baby!  And I don't mean that in a good way.  These folks do not have the first clue as to how to run a motel.  Your room (I guarantee it) would not be ready to go.  They can't offer a room, as if motel's were not in existence 60 years ago.  They have no clue.  Then there is the clientele.
OMG.  Smoking, loud at 04:00 AM, and dysfunctional.  Screaming and banging on the wall, fighting (shouting) and the management does nothing.

Free magazines given out up front, to be used to smack the cockroaches.
STAY FAR AWAY.

data.title: Unusual Motel 6
data.text: This Motel 6 was not the ordinary Motel 6. Probably private owned prior to becoming Motel 6. An old property,Big rooms,clean, good comfortable beds,microwave,fridge. good TV. Good location for our needs.

data.title: Located in slum area
data.text:
Located in a slum area.  Room was dingy and desperately needed updating.  Floor popped when walking.  No stopper in the sink, so it's easy to lose something down the drain.  Two towel bars missing.  One washcloth for two people; had to call for another one.  People smoking and talking loudly just outside our non-smoking room until nearly midnight; had to call the desk to come and quiet them down.  But it started again a few hours later.

On the positive side the desk help was courteous and helpful and the bed was good.

data.title: Nice Rooms
data.text:
Pulled in after 10:00 pm towing a car for sale at the January 2013 collector car auctions. Friendly Motel 6 staff kindly moved their car to allow us space to park our pickup and trailer with recently restored antique car across several spaces right outside the office. Only other longer truck and trailer parking were a few spaces outside along a back alleyway.
Interesting two buildings with rooms looking into central courtyards resort fashion, with parking between the two buildings and surrounding them on the outsides. Makes it look like an industrial complex at first but rather attractive in the inner courtyards the rooms all face.
We entered to get to our rooms through the lobby which seemed to provide some security for the rooms in our building.
Our room was very clean and well maintained. The bathroom appeared to have been recently renovated and the shower nozzle was high enough to not have to bend over to wash your hair.  Beds were comfortable. Room quickly heated up in the rare Phoenix freezing temperatures we experienced.
A nice economical motel with friendly management, but is located in a not too upscale neighborhood from what I could see.

data.title: We loved it!
data.text:
We stayed here Apr. 28th thru May 4th, 2012 during our vacation to the Phoenix area. The room was great, it was very clean, the beds were very 

comfy. Loved the fridge and microwave. But the best thing for us was the staff. Very friendly, very helpful and very willing to answer all our questions 

and concerns. We never took advantage of swimming at the pool, but we did check it out and it was very clean. We definately loved the short walk to 

the downtown area. We will definately stay here again, in fact we have a trip planned for this coming August and the Motel 6  will be our home away 

from home again. We booked thru the Motel 6 reservation system and we felt the rates were good but since the staff was so helpful we think we will go 

directly thru the hotel itself for future reservations.
